name: Vietnamese Lemongrass Beef and Noodles
author: MommyFromSeattle
summary: This is a classic Vietnamese dish that is so simple to make. Sauteed beef marinated in lemongrass and garlic and tossed with cold vermicelli noodles and fresh herbs. Great on warm days or it makes a quick, weeknight meal.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons soy-based liquid seasoning (such as Maggi®)
2 tablespoons warm water, or more as needed
2  fresh red Thai chile peppers, minced
1 bunch Thai basil leaves, chopped, or to taste
1 bunch cilantro, chopped, or to taste
1 cup fresh bean sprouts, or to taste
directions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil
Add vermicelli noodles and cook until softened, 12 minutes
Drain noodles and rinse with cold water, stirring to separate the noodles
Combine lemongrass, soy-based seasoning, sherry, brown sugar, and garlic in a bowl
Marinate flank steak in mixture, tossing evenly, and let sit for 30 minutes
Pour warm water into a small bowl; add sugar and lemon juice
Stir in fish sauce, Thai peppers, and garlic
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat
Cook sliced flank steak until firm but slightly pink in the center, 5 to 6 minutes per side
Arrange cooked vermicelli noodles in bowls for serving
Place steak on top and garnish with Thai basil leaves, cilantro, and bean sprouts
Pour sweetened fish sauce over the top
